intro: Sphaeranthus confertifolius, commonly known as the dense-leaved globeflower, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular inflorescence composed of numerous small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, densely arranged leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with prominent central disk florets. Sphaeranthus confertifolius is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and forest understories, where it thrives in humid conditions.
